meanings.definition: A hole in a machine or engine through which oil is added or drained.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic carefully inspected the oilholes in the engine to ensure proper lubrication.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to clean the oilholes regularly to prevent any blockages.
meanings.sent3: As the oilholes whispered to each other, the engine purred contentedly.
meanings.sent4: The oilholes in the machine were like tiny mouths, eagerly drinking up the oil.
meanings.sent5: The oilholes gleamed in the sunlight, beckoning for attention and care.

meanings.definition: A hole in a rock formation through which oil seeps.
meanings.sent1: The geologist studied the oilholes in the rock to understand the natural oil flow.
meanings.sent2: Oil companies often drill near oilholes to extract the precious resource.
meanings.sent3: The oilholes in the rock seemed to be secret passageways for the oil to escape.
meanings.sent4: The oilholes in the rock were like tiny fountains of black gold.
meanings.sent5: The oilholes in the rock whispered tales of ancient oil reserves waiting to be discovered.
